body.pretty: ⊢ ((c0 ∈ DivRing ∧ c1 ∈ DivRing ∧ c2 ∈(SubRing ` c0))→ c1 ∈ DivRing)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cdr), wcel(c1, cdr), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wcel(c3, clvec))
-| wb(wcel(c3, clvec), wa(wcel(c3, clmod), wcel(cfv(csca, c3), cdr)))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cfv(csra, c0), c2))
-| wceq(c1, co(c0, cress, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ DivRing ∧ c1 ∈ DivRing ∧ c2 ∈(SubRing ` c0))→ c3 ∈ LVec)
⊣ (c3 ∈ LVec ↔(c3 ∈ LMod ∧(Scalar ` c3)∈ DivRing))
⊣ c3 =((subringAlg ` c0)` c2)
⊣ c1 =(c0[|`s]c2)

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c3, clvec), wa(wcel(c3, clmod), wcel(cfv(csca, c3), cdr)))
-| wceq(cfv(csca, c3), cfv(csca, c3))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c3 ∈ LVec ↔(c3 ∈ LMod ∧(Scalar ` c3)∈ DivRing))
⊣ (Scalar ` c3)=(Scalar ` c3)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cdr), wcel(c1, cdr), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wcel(c3, clvec))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cfv(csra, c0), c2))
-| wceq(c1, co(c0, cress, c2))
-| wceq(cfv(csca, c3), cfv(csca, c3))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ DivRing ∧ c1 ∈ DivRing ∧ c2 ∈(SubRing ` c0))→ c3 ∈ LVec)
⊣ c3 =((subringAlg ` c0)` c2)
⊣ c1 =(c0[|`s]c2)
⊣ (Scalar ` c3)=(Scalar ` c3)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cdr), wcel(c1, cdr), wcel(c2, cfv(csubrg, c0))), wcel(c3, clvec))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cfv(csra, c0), c2))
-| wceq(c1, co(c0, cress, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ DivRing ∧ c1 ∈ DivRing ∧ c2 ∈(SubRing ` c0))→ c3 ∈ LVec)
⊣ c3 =((subringAlg ` c0)` c2)
⊣ c1 =(c0[|`s]c2)

comment: Given a sub division ring ` F ` of a division ring ` E ` , ` E ` may be considered as a vector space over ` F ` , which becomes the field of scalars. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-May-2023.)
